workflow.name: Automate Google Maps lead generation with Perplexity AI and email verification
workflow.description:
## Overview ‚ú®

This template **finds businesses on Google Maps ‚Üí writes to Google Sheets ‚Üí enriches + **verifies email contact** so your outreach stays clean and deliverable. It includes **Sticky Notes**  to explain the flow and setup.

## What it does üîé‚û°Ô∏èüìÑ‚û°Ô∏è‚úÖ

1. **Search & save**: Fetch places and append rows (Name, Address, Website, Rating, Phone) to your sheet.
2. **Enrich**: Ask an LLM (Perplexity) for `Email` + a short company `Background`.
3. **Verify emails**: For [Email Verification we use VerificarEmails](https://www.verificaremails.com/en/)  to validate every email address before writing back (fewer bounces, less blocking).

> ‚ÑπÔ∏è **VerificarEmails node**: install the **community node** `@verificaremails/n8n-nodes-verificaremails` (Settings ‚Üí Community Nodes) and use it **until it‚Äôs approved as a core node**. ‚ú®
[Youtube Video](https://youtu.be/EA6fWZtIXhk)

## Requirements üîê

* Use n8n **Credentials** for: Google Sheets, Perplexity (Bearer), and VerificarEmails.
* Keep prompts **short** and `temperature: 0` to lower cost.
* Create a Google Sheet with the following headers: UUID, Name, Address, Website, Rating	Email, Valid, Email, Phone, Valid Phone, Summary

## How to run ‚ñ∂Ô∏è

1. Set your search params (query, locale, pages).
2. Run the flow: it saves results ‚Üí enriches ‚Üí **verifies emails** ‚Üí updates the sheet.
3. If the read/update step doesn‚Äôt run, ensure the **finalization (Done) path** and the correct **sheet/tab** are selected.

## Why verify? ‚úâÔ∏èüßπ

Bad emails cause **bounces, throttling, and blocks**. Verifying first protects sender reputation and improves deliverability.
Beyond emails, [VerificarEmails](https://www.verificaremails.com/en/) also offers **phone, names. Check [Email Validation API](https://www.verificaremails.com/docs/en/) documentation to better understand verification results.

parameters.content:
## Google Maps Data Extraction
**What it does:**
Pages through Serper‚Äôs **Google Places** results, turns each `place` into a row, **appends to Google Sheets**, and **stops** when `places` is empty.

**Nodes (brief):**

* **Manual Trigger** ‚Äì Start.
* **Set parameters** ‚Äì q, gl, hl, num, apiKey, spreadsheetId, sheet names, pageStart/pageLimit.
* **Code: Make pages** ‚Äì Emits `{page: 1..N}`.
* **Split In Batches** ‚Äì Sends one page per run.
* **HTTP Request** ‚Äì POST to `https://google.serper.dev/places` with `{ q, gl, hl, num, page }`.
* **IF** ‚Äì If `places.length > 0`, continue; else end loop.
* **Code: Map to rows** ‚Äì Map each place ‚Üí `{ UUID, Name, Address, Website, Rating, Phone(normalized), Opening Hours }`.
* **Google Sheets: Append row (Resultados)** ‚Äì Append rows; then back to **Split In Batches** for next page.

**Workflow: Maps ‚Üí Sheet ‚Üí Email Verification**

1. **Search & save:** Find places on Google Maps and add them to the sheet.
2. **Fill details:** Add missing info (email + short description).
3. **Verify emails:** Every email is checked (format, domain, and inbox when possible). If it can‚Äôt be confirmed, we set **‚ÄúN/A‚Äù**.
4. **Update sheet:** Only **verified** emails are written back.

**Why this matters:** You keep clean, reliable contact data and avoid sending to bad addresses.

**IMPORTANT** Before run that workflow you need a Verificaremails.com account.

user.name: Antxon Pous
user.bio: Verificaremails is an all-in-one platform for data verification and lead generation. We validate emails, phone numbers (HLR & MNP), names, and postal addresses, ensuring accuracy and better deliverability. Our tools also enrich customer databases and integrate with n8n to automate workflows for lead management and communication. With precision and scalability, we help businesses save costs, improve ROI, and grow smarter.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
